pull.title: Add req- prefixes to comply with BIP21.

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Bitcoin (dont fork from here, fork from bitcoin/bitcoin)

events.body: No, the original intent was that req- prefixes are optional and can be applied to any params.  ie a merchant may want to enforce or not enforce an expires param.  That should be clarified in the bip. (see https://github.com/genjix/bips/pull/4)

In that case should there be a 

```
fShouldReturnFalse = false;
```

in the `amount` handling?
This is the type of code that aught to have unit tests. I don't know nuthin about unit testing with Qt; is it easy to get qmake to compile unit tests, and/or is there support in Qt for unit tests?

Still gotta add a ton more test, but I put in a bitcoin-qt test suite structure.  Just build with
qmake bitcoin-qt.pro BITCOIN_QT_TEST=1; make 
you should then find a bitcoin-qt_test exe to call

events.message: Add -req prefixes to comply with BIP21.
Add Bitcoin-Qt test suite with some bitcoin: URL Tests to start.

events.body: OK, there we go, test away.
